definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist

sentences.english: Take care to avoid to put your fingers on polished surface.

sentences.english: I'll do the rest with the belt sander .
sentences.chinese: 我將用帶式磨光機做接下去的。

sentences.english: Counterfeiters are even expected to open up into small chunks Hill polished material.

sentences.english: These holes were to be ground smooth, painted, and filled with a rubber plug.
sentences.chinese: 這些孔要磨光，油漆，並塞以橡膠塞。

sentences.english: Stilnovo - Two layers pre-sanded and pre-treated floor.

sentences.english: Steels delivered by polishing shall have surface without defectiveness .

sentences.english: I’m going to sand it and put on a light colored stain.
sentences.chinese: 我打算用砂紙磨光，然後着點淡色。

sentences.english: A polished stone tool used in bookbinding to burnish the edges of books after applying metal leaf.
sentences.chinese: 中義一種用來使裝訂上金屬葉的書背磨光的石材工具。

sentences.english: The striated and polished surfaces are called slickensides .
sentences.chinese: 有條痕的磨光面則稱爲擦痕面。

sentences.english: Examination and Scale & Polish will both be limited to 2 visits per year of insurance.
sentences.chinese: 牙科檢查以及去垢和磨光，每個保險年度均限2次。

sentences.english: We can tailor- make our gem polishers to suit your requirements.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以特別設計寶石磨光機，以符合你們的要求。

sentences.english: You can use a sandpaper to polish coarse surfaces.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用砂紙去磨光粗糙的表面。

sentences.english: The other is smoothing of combination of parametric curve.
sentences.chinese: 二是組合參數曲線的磨光。

sentences.english: Syrian popular impatience in that respect is sure to rise.
sentences.chinese: 在這個問題上，敘利亞民衆的耐心肯定會磨光的。

edge and corner/protrusion/sharpness (of a protrusion)/craggy/ridge corner
